pullRequest.body:
An easy argument using the chain rule.

Noteworthy:
- we require the domain and codomain to be Banach manifolds (so we can apply the open mapping theorem to deduce continuity of the differential's inverse). This is not required mathematically (the local diffeomorphism provides us with a local inverse), but for type-theoretic reasons.
This [zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Proof.20by.20rfl.20fails.20after.20adding.20rcases.20on.20choose/near/409243898) has more details.
- applying `ContinuousLinearEquiv.ofBijective` seems to require local instances that the tangent space is a normed space. This feels inelegant; is there a better way?

- [x] depends on: #8736
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Here's a reduced version of the first failing proof by `rfl`: paste the following after the end of the `Basic` section, i.e. this requires local diffeos at a point.
```lean
variable [SmoothManifoldWithCorners I M] [SmoothManifoldWithCorners J N]
noncomputable def IsLocalDiffeomorphAt.mydef {f : M ‚Üí N} {x : M}
    (hf : IsLocalDiffeomorphAt I J n f x) /-(hn : 1 ‚â§ n)-/ :
    ContinuousLinearEquiv (RingHom.id ùïú) (TangentSpace I x) (TangentSpace J (f x)) := by
  choose Œ¶ hyp using hf
  -- rcases hyp with ‚ü®hxU, heq‚ü© -- uncommenting this line breaks the proof below!
  exact {
    toFun := mfderiv I J f x
    invFun := sorry
    left_inv := sorry
    right_inv := sorry
    continuous_toFun := sorry
    continuous_invFun := sorry
    map_add' := sorry
    map_smul' := sorry
  }

lemma foo {f : M ‚Üí N} {x : M} (hf : IsLocalDiffeomorphAt I J n f x) :
  hf.mydef = mfderiv I J f x := by rfl
```

Uncommenting the `rcases` line breaks the proof by `rfl`. Insights why this is are welcome :-)
Update: Asked on zulip, Eric Wieser could enlighten me. Working on a fix locally.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#8736~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

I've thought a bit more about this, and I really think that it's a bit of a shame not to use the "morally correct" proof which gives the "explicit" inverse. I've played a bit with it, and I think that a promising approach would be to define the `localInverseAt` a point of a local diffeomorphism using [Function.invFunOn](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Set/Function.html#Function.invFunOn), and prove that both compositions are [Filter.EventuallyEq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Filter/Basic.html#Filter.EventuallyEq) to the identity, and then use [Filter.EventuallyEq.mfderiv_eq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Geometry/Manifold/MFDeriv.html#Filter.EventuallyEq.mfderiv_eq).

@ADedecker Thanks for taking the time to think about this, I appreciate it. I would indeed be intrigued if this could be made to work.

I tried to make this work; I don't find it altogether obvious. For instance, working with `localInverseAt` is harder than I'd like; it might be easier to choose a partial diffeomorphism $\Phi$ and work with $\Phi.symm$ instead... I'll put this aside for now; feel free to play with it. (Otherwise, I'll return to this in the new year.)

As a general comment, I believe these are the kinds of experiments that would lead to improvements of the existing API for analysis / differential geometry. It would be nice to have a community-sourced collection of "this API is difficult to use because XYZ" to save future users the trouble of rediscovering the issue, and to motivate API development at a lower level in mathlib. Should we use github issues for this purpose?

I won't have time to play with this right now; I suggest letting this be good enough and recording a TODO about the follow-up.
@ADedecker What do you think? (You're welcome to try implementing your suggestion.)
I think we shouldn't merge this version, and instead directly go for the correct one. Do you want me to try to implement it?
@sgouezel Thank you for the offer. Help is very welcome.
Sorry, misclicked (~~but probably no harm to merge master ...~~ oops now it doesn't build)

@sgouezel Friendly ping - just in the case this dropped from your radar: your help is still welcome.
(This project is not time-sensitive, so no worries if you're busy.)
I will get to this PR eventually, but have other higher-priority things to do right now. If you're reading this, help jumping in and fixing the above is welcome.

### PR summary [6cd061e80c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/8738/commits/6cd061e80c68323fb1b016e1ff0f9692fd3a6024)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsLocalDiffeomorphAt.mfderiv_toContinuousLinearEquiv`
`+ LeftInverse.of_composition`
`+ PartialDiffeomorph.isLocalDiffeomorphAt`
`+ RightInverse.of_composition`
`+ contmdiffOn_localInverse`
`+ localInverse`
`+ localInverse_contMDiffAt`
`+ localInverse_contMDiffOn`
`+ localInverse_eqOn_left`
`+ localInverse_eqOn_right`
`+ localInverse_eventuallyEq_left`
`+ localInverse_eventuallyEq_right`
`+ localInverse_isLocalDiffeomorphAt`
`+ localInverse_left_inv`
`+ localInverse_mdifferentiableAt`
`+ localInverse_mem_source`
`+ localInverse_mem_target`
`+ localInverse_open_source`
`+ localInverse_right_inv`
`+ mfderiv_toContinuousLinearEquiv_coe`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Note to self: see [this branch](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/MR-local-diffeos-differential-v3) for an attempt to make Anatole's approach work; in progress.

I think the right way to avoid this lemma is to make a `ContinuousLinearMap` version of [LinearMap.congr_fun](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/LinearMap.html#LinearMap.congr_fun)
That's better indeed. Good idea!

pullRequest.title: feat: differential of a local diffeomorphism is a continuous linear equivalence
